comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
This photo must have been taken from the tower at Government House.

Thanks for posting these Garden Palace photos which I had not come across before.  It was a fascinating building with a wonderful history.  

The Garden Palace Fire Gallery is well worth a look, but I tried searches of Photo Investigator and it produced almost nothing.  Am I doing something wrong?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] These photos aren't on Photo Investigator, yet. They are part of NRS 4481 which we have been uploading; it is a very large collection and they will be added eventually :) In the meantime there are some photos of the Palace Gardens here and here and here. The Garden Palace Fire Gallery has more photos plus an account of the fire by the night watchman. It's incredible to think that this massive building burned down in about 40 minutes. AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Thank you.  Looking forward to seeing the collection.

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Sydney had no iron works to produce sufficient cast iron so it was built in timber :(

Im guessing the mountains of ash from the fire was great for the Gardens :)

comment.author: 73199923@N00
73199923@N00
comment._content: Great reference on construction by Peter Proudfoot, Roslyn Maguire and Robert Freestone "Colonial city, global city : Sydney's International Exhibition 1879" trove.nla.gov.au/work/35667688?versionId=45804525 Overlay of the old Garden Palace as it stood in what is now the Sydney Botanic Gardens And Today binged.it/T7huni
